Topic.Title: FUTURES ARE TANKING!

Message.Msg: Aren't you so happy there is no multicent uptick rule anymore? Let's see, this morning the futures were nicely up and green and the market sold off today and BAC closed down. Now the futures are red and we are to think the markets will sell off again? Let's see, that's heads you win and tails I lose. Guess that simply means that with no multicent uptick rule they can make the market sell off at their will, any time they want. Futures up, sell off...futures down, sell off. What's wrong with this picture? Securities and Exchange Commission do you think this is beneficial and balanced for investors and orderly markets? DYODD JMHO

Obama Care is just the beginning of his achievements. America is pioneering the way in striving to open a path for the rest of the nations of the world... leading in democracy, freedom, equality, justice, in a diverse society of all races, faiths and cultures... all living together in peace under the rule of law. This is where the human species is experimenting what the future will be like for the world... if human species wants to survive rising above superficial and artificial differences that separate us as humans. That differences of skin color, race, culture, and faith are only superficial differences in the human species on this small and fragile planet of earth. Let freedom ring in a land where the rule of law is equally applicable and opportunity for education, growth, and happiness is available to all... in liberty, equality and justice. This a HISTORIC MOMENT for the WORLD!

Topic.Title: Cut GW Bush s pension to $100 the month.

Message.Msg: The CEO, the general, the mother, the father....all must take ultimate responsibility for their charges and the awesome power granted them to lead those charges. So it is, more so in fact, with the President of the United States of America. "The buck stops here", as one President so rightly stated. Hence, as GW Bush, et al, has engaged, under false pretenses and witness, the United States of America in an irresponsible, morally corrupt, fiscally disastrous, massive military adventure (i.e. The Iraq War) that has had devastating effects on US and Iraqi citizenry, economics and future prospects for decades to come, it is adjudged that GW Bush, et al, is guilty of criminal malfeasance and negligence, in addition to being a cocky li'l punk. The CIA will spare no expense in tracking these (monstrously large) funds down. 3) GW Bush, et al, is hereby ordered to visit every slain or injured warrior, civilian etc, be they Iraqi, American or other, who participated in this military travesty. GW Bush, et al, will prostrate themselves before such unfortunates and beg their forgiveness. The rod will be applied if absolute sincerity is not evinced. Message.Title: History does not support the Anti-abortion position
Message.Msg: Circa 380: The Apostolic Constitutions allowed abortion if it was done early enough in pregnancy. But it condemned abortion if the fetus was of human shape and contained a soul. St. Augustine (354-430) accepted the Aristotelian Greek Pagan concept of "delayed ensoulment". He wrote that a human soul cannot live in an unformed body. 3 Thus, early in pregnancy, an abortion is not murder because no soul is destroyed (or, more accurately, only a vegetable or animal soul is terminated). Pope Innocent III (1161-1216): He determined that a monk who had arranged for his lover to have an abortion was not guilty of murder if the fetus was not "animated" at the time. Early in the 13th century, he stated that the soul enters the body of the fetus at the time of "quickening" - when the woman first feels movement of the fetus. Before that time, abortion was a less serious sin, because it terminated only potential human person, not an actual human person. St. Thomas Aquinas (1225-1274): St. Thomas thought that the soul did not come to the fetus ('ensoulment') until sometime after conception. In fact, he considered abortion gravely sinful, teaching that it was a grave sin against the natural law to kill the fetus at any stage and a graver sin of homicide to do so after ensoulment. Pope Sixtus V (1588) issued a Papal bull "Effraenatam" which threatened those who carried out abortions at any stage of gestation with excommunication and the death penalty. Pope Gregory XIV (1591) revoked the previous Papal bull and reinstated the "quickening" test, which he determined happened 116 days into pregnancy (16½ weeks).

Message.Title: And a good night to all on this new Petraeus book title!..What a mistake!
Message.Msg: It appears as though the local ABC News Denver affiliate used a parodied version of biographer Paula Broadwell's book cover during a news report on Gen. Petraeus' extramarital affair. Petraeus resigned as director of the CIA last week, citing an extramarital affair with his biographer, Broadwell. An image of the cover of her book on Petraeus, "All In" was used during the news report. Americablog noticed that the station seemed to mistakenly use a fake version of the book cover. The real title "All In" was replaced with the title "All Up In My Snatch." The Weekly Standard picked up Americablog's story, and wrote that a call was placed to the affiliate's assignment desk seeking confirmation: "'That's correct,' said the women working the assignment desk, confirming that the wrong book cover had been aired. 'It was a mistake.'"

Topic.Title: Markets not liking the FISCAL CLIFF has been DOWN sine the election

Message.Msg: bcboxboy, not sure why, but can't reply directly to your post... You may well be right that BAC won't go below $8 - I'm not predicting that it will. My point was simply that it can - and that the stock has performed similarly in recent history, so that saying it will "never" happen is an invalid statement. "and the only thing holding it back now is the fiscal cliff." That's not quite true, either, though it is a major factor. There is also: 1) EU recession risk 2) Greece default / exit risk 3) Greece debt forgiveness, BofA would be #1 or #2 worst impacted 4)Litigation (This is multiple cases, but I'll be kind and consolidate) 4a) the risk that BofA would be required to re-acuire $26B in toxic loans (part of litigation) 5) Obama stated intent to increase regulations, increasing capital requirements and decreasing pofitability 5a) Now Senator Warren 6) declining profit margins ...by any objective measure, more than just one thing (the fiscal cliff) You may well be right and BofA is headed past $10. But if you aren't willing to make an objective assessment of the risks, than you can't make a fully informed decision.
